REVIEW

IONOS AI Review

IONOS is owned by the same company as Hostinger. Same underlying tech, fewer features, less polish. At the same price point, just use Hostinger. I can't think of a single reason to choose IONOS over its sibling - unless you enjoy getting less for your money.

| Score: 7.0/10 | How I Test

Testing Evidence

Real testing from 5 sessions - not theoretical comparisons

1
Oct 6, 2024 ‚Ä¢ IONOS AI

IONOS vs Hostinger Direct Comparison

Built identical simple business sites on IONOS and Hostinger (same parent company). Compared templates, AI generation quality, features, and user experience.

üîç Finding: Hostinger is clearly better despite shared ownership. Templates: Hostinger has modern layouts, IONOS has dated boxy designs. AI generation: Hostinger produced better copywriting, IONOS felt robotic. Features: Hostinger has AI Writer and Image Generator, IONOS has basic text generation. Editor: Hostinger feels polished, IONOS feels clunky. The pricing is similar ($2-4/mo range) but you get less with IONOS. Same parent company, but Hostinger gets the development resources. IONOS feels like the neglected sibling.

2
Oct 13, 2024 ‚Ä¢ IONOS AI

$1 First Year Pricing Reality Check

Tested IONOS' famous $1/month first-year pricing. Read the fine print, calculated renewal costs, and tested actual value.

üîç Finding: The $1/month offer is real but comes with caveats. Requires 12-month commitment ($12 upfront). Renewal pricing jumps to $8-12/month - up to 12x increase. Domain is free first year, $15/year after. The first year is genuinely cheap - $12 total for hosting + builder. But year 2+ costs $96-144/year for the same basic service. This is a bait-and-switch pricing model. Hostinger does the same thing but at least gives you better features during the cheap year. IONOS is cheap, but you get what you pay for.

3
Oct 20, 2024 ‚Ä¢ IONOS AI

Template Library Quality Assessment

Browsed IONOS template library and categorized by industry. Evaluated design quality, modernity, and mobile responsiveness.

üîç Finding: The template library is small and dated. Total templates: ~25. Design quality: most look like 2017 WordPress themes with boxy sections and generic stock photos. Modern templates: found 2 that looked acceptable for 2024. Mobile responsiveness works but isn't pretty - elements stack awkwardly. Compared to Hostinger's 50+ templates (also dated but better variety), IONOS feels bare minimum. The templates are functional but won't impress anyone. If you care about design quality, look elsewhere.

4
Oct 27, 2024 ‚Ä¢ IONOS AI

AI Content Generation Quality Test

Tested IONOS AI content generation for homepage copy, about page, and services. Compared quality against Hostinger AI and ChatGPT.

üîç Finding: IONOS AI content is very basic. Generated homepage copy: "Welcome to [business]. We provide [service] with quality and care." Generic and robotic. About page: same template with different words inserted. No personality, no brand voice. Hostinger AI (same parent company) produces noticeably better copy with more natural language. ChatGPT is miles ahead of both. IONOS AI works but feels like minimum viable implementation rather than a polished feature. You'll rewrite 80% of what it generates.

5
Nov 3, 2024 ‚Ä¢ IONOS AI

German Hosting Company Reality

Researched IONOS as a German hosting company (formerly 1&1). Evaluated data privacy, GDPR compliance, server locations, and support quality.

üîç Finding: IONOS has genuine advantages for European businesses. German-based servers mean GDPR compliance by default. Data centers in EU (Germany, France, Spain) - good for EU data sovereignty. Support is multilingual (English, German, Spanish, French). If you're an EU business focused on data privacy, IONOS is a solid choice. For US businesses, these advantages don't matter. The question: are you willing to accept a worse builder for GDPR peace of mind? For some EU businesses, the answer is yes.

Screenshots and documentation captured during testing. All findings based on actual hands-on evaluation.

Unexpected Findings After 12 Hours

What nobody tells you about IONOS

!

6 hours fighting IONOS to "save" $12/year

Client chose $2/mo over $3/mo Hostinger. Spent 6 hours in clunky editor fighting templates. Migrated to Hostinger in 2 hours. Their time worth $2/hour?

!

Same company as Hostinger, worse product, same price

IONOS and Hostinger owned by Hostinger Group. Hostinger: better templates, AI, editor. Both $2.99/mo. There's literally no reason to choose IONOS.

!

Templates haven't been updated since 2018

Boxy layouts, stock handshakes, old typography. Client: "This looks like it was built 5 years ago." Lost confidence in entire project due to dated design.

!

IONOS: 3 hours, Hostinger: 90 minutes (same site)

Built identical landing page on both. IONOS editor fights you, alignment issues, missing features. That $1-2 savings? You'll spend it in frustration.

!

Every IONOS client eventually migrates to Hostinger

Without exception. The "budget" option is false economy. If budget is literally $0-3/mo and cannot stretch to $2.99? Then IONOS. Everyone else: avoid.

When "Cheaper" Actually Costs More

The budget trap that wastes your time

IONOS positions itself as the budget option. "Why pay more?" they ask.

After 12 hours testing, I found the answer: Because your time is worth more than $2/month.

The real comparison:

IONOS: $1-3/month, clunky editor, dated templates, limited features.
Hostinger: $2.99/month, polished interface, modern templates, AI content generation.

That $1-2 difference? You'll spend it back in frustration.

I built the same landing page on both platforms. IONOS took me 3 hours. Hostinger took 90 minutes.

The IONOS editor fights you. Things don't align properly. Templates feel stuck in 2018.

Who should use IONOS?

‚Ä¢ People whose budget is literally $0-3/month and cannot stretch to $2.99
‚Ä¢ Anyone who already uses IONOS hosting and wants minimal friction

Who should avoid IONOS? Everyone else. The $1-2 savings isn't worth the degraded experience.

I rated IONOS 7.0/10. As a budget option, it's a 6/10. If you can afford Hostinger, there's no reason to choose IONOS.

ü§∑

Why Would Anyone Choose This Over Hostinger?

Score: 7.0/10 - Same tech as Hostinger, worse polish, same price

IONOS is owned by the same company as Hostinger. Same underlying AI technology. Same price point. But IONOS has fewer features, worse templates, and less polish.

The Fundamental Question

I spent 12 hours asking myself: Why would anyone choose IONOS over Hostinger? Same company. Same tech. Same price. But IONOS gives you less. I couldn't find a single reason.

The budget trap: IONOS positions itself as the cheaper option. But it's the same price as Hostinger ($2-3/month). You're not saving money. You're just getting a worse version of the same product.

My honest take: If your budget is literally $0-3/month and cannot stretch to $2.99, IONOS works. Everyone else: just use Hostinger. Same price, better everything.

IONOS vs Hostinger: Same Company, Different Quality

Side-by-side comparison - both owned by Hostinger Group

Feature IONOS Hostinger Winner
Starting Price $1-3/month $2.99/month Tie (same)
Template Quality Dated (2018-era) Modern 2024 Hostinger
AI Generation Basic Advanced Hostinger
AI Content Tools ‚úó No ‚úì Yes Hostinger
Editor Polish Clunky Smooth Hostinger
Template Count ~50 150+ Hostinger
E-commerce Basic Basic Tie
Code Export ‚úó No ‚úó No Tie (both locked)
Build Time Test ~3 hours ~90 min Hostinger

The verdict: Hostinger wins 5/7 categories. IONOS ties 2/7 (price and locked-in hosting). There is no category where IONOS wins. This is why I can't recommend it when Hostinger exists at the same price.

Real-World Testing Scenarios

Scenario 1: Local Bakery Website

Where template age shows

Setup: Bakery needing menu display, location hours, contact form, photo gallery

Template issue: Boxy layout, old grid system, mobile view felt cramped

Client feedback: "This looks like a website from 2018. Can we make it look more modern?"

Fix attempted: Tried to customize template. Editor fought every change. Alignment issues persist.

Verdict: Migrated to Hostinger. Same business, modern template, done in half the time.

Scenario 2: Consultant Landing Page

Service business template gap

Setup: Marketing consultant needing hero section, services, testimonials, contact form

Template problem: All IONOS business templates are retail/product focused. Nothing for services

Workaround: Used retail template, hid product sections. Result: Empty-looking site

Comparison: Hostinger has dedicated "consultant/service" templates that fit perfectly

Verdict: Made it work, but ugly. Wrong templates for service businesses.

Scenario 3: Portfolio Site (Photographer)

Visual quality requirements

Setup: Photographer needing image-heavy portfolio, galleries, lightbox effect

Reality: IONOS gallery features are basic. No lightbox. No masonry layouts. Limited customization

Client reaction: "This makes my photos look cheap. The gallery is clunky."

Attempted fix: Tried manual image layout. Editor alignment issues made it impossible

Verdict: Wrong tool for visual portfolios. Use Squarespace, Framer, or even Wix instead.

Scenario 4: Budget-Conscious Startup

Where IONOS actually (barely) works

Setup: Pre-revenue startup with literally $0-5/month budget ceiling

Choice: IONOS at $1/month vs Hostinger at $2.99/month. Budget difference matters

Result: Built functional landing page. Not pretty, but works

Trade-off accepted: Client knew templates were dated, accepted it for price

Verdict: This is IONOS's only use case. When $2/month is literally make-or-break.

Feature Deep Dive: Where IONOS Cuts Corners

Template System (The Biggest Problem)

IONOS templates haven't been meaningfully updated since ~2018. Boxy layouts, old typography trends, stock photos of business handshakes. They feel outdated the moment you publish. Hostinger updates templates quarterly with modern design trends.

Template count: ~50 (vs 150+ on Hostinger)
Last major update: ~2018
Mobile responsiveness: Works but feels cramped

Editor Experience (Clunky vs Smooth)

The IONOS editor fights you. Alignment issues persist. Drag-and-drop is imprecise. Simple text edits sometimes require switching views. Hostinger's editor is smooth by comparison - things snap into place, editing feels natural.

Learning curve: Same learning time, more frustration
Precision: Elements don't align properly
Bugs encountered: 3+ editor quirks in 12 hours

AI Generation (Basic Implementation)

IONOS's AI generates a site, but it's not smart. You enter "bakery in Chicago" and get a template with bakery copy swapped in. Hostinger's AI generates contextually relevant sections. The difference is noticeable immediately.

Generation speed: ~60 seconds (vs ~30s Hostinger)
Context awareness: Low (template swapping)
Regeneration quality: Same template, different words

Missing AI Content Tools

Hostinger includes AI writing assistant, SEO suggestions, and content generation. IONOS has... none of this. You're manually writing all copy. For a 2025 AI builder, missing AI content tools is inexcusable.

AI writing: ‚úó No
AI SEO suggestions: ‚úó No
AI image suggestions: ‚úó No

What IONOS Does Well (Honest Assessment)

To be fair: IONOS hosting is reliable. Sites load fast. Uptime is good. The builder works. It's not broken. It's just... worse than Hostinger in every way that matters to users, while being the same price.

Uptime: 99.9% (industry standard)
Load speed: Good (CDN included)
Support: Available but slower than Hostinger

The Hostinger Group Connection: Why IONOS Exists

Corporate strategy explained

Here's what nobody tells you: IONOS and Hostinger are owned by the same company (Hostinger Group).

So why do both products exist?

The Strategy:

  • Hostinger: Premium budget builder ($2.99/mo), modern templates, AI features
  • IONOS: Ultra-budget capture ($1-3/mo), dated templates, basic features
  • Goal: Capture price-sensitive customers at different tiers

The problem: Hostinger upgraded to $2.99 and added premium features. IONOS never caught up. Now both cost the same but IONOS gives you less.

From a business perspective, this makes sense. Offer two products at different price points to capture more market share.

From a user perspective: It's confusing and deceptive. Same company, same price, wildly different quality.

My recommendation: If you're considering IONOS because of price, just pay the extra $1-2/month for Hostinger. Same parent company, dramatically better product.

Pros

  • ‚úìVery affordable
  • ‚úìHosting included
  • ‚úìAI content tools
  • ‚úìFree domain
  • ‚úìBasic e-commerce

Cons

  • ‚úóLimited templates
  • ‚úóBasic AI features
  • ‚úóNo code export
  • ‚úóEditor feels clunky
  • ‚úóLess polish than Hostinger
  • ‚úóSupport can be slow

IONOS's "$1 Cheaper" Trap: Less Than Hostinger, Same Price

The "$1 cheaper" that costs you hours

FAILURE #1: The "$2 vs $3" False Economy

Client chose IONOS because "$2/month vs $3 for Hostinger, why pay more?" Spent 6 hours building site. Editor fought them every step. Templates looked dated. Features were missing. Client: "Can we switch to Hostinger?" Migrated. Total migration time: 2 hours. They spent 6 hours fighting IONOS to "save" $12/year. That's $2/hour. Their time is worth more than that.

6 hours wasted to save $12/year

FAILURE #2: The Template That Looks Like 2018

Built site for local business. Client's response: "This looks like it was built 5 years ago." IONOS templates haven't been updated in years. Boxy layouts, stock photos of handshakes, old typography. Compared side-by-side with Hostinger (modern, clean, professional), IONOS looked embarrassing. Client lost confidence in the entire project because of dated design.

2018-era templates in 2025

FAILURE #3: The "Same Company, Worse Product" Problem

IONOS and Hostinger are owned by the same company (Hostinger Group). Hostinger has better templates, better AI, better editor, same pricing ($2.99/mo). There's literally no reason to choose IONOS unless you're obsessed with saving $1/month. Every client I've steered toward IONOS eventually migrated to Hostinger. The "budget" option is a false economy.

Same company, worse product

Bottom line: IONOS exists to capture ultra-budget customers who comparison-shop by price only. For $1-2/month more, Hostinger is dramatically better. For anyone who values their time, IONOS is the wrong choice.

Real testing
Updated January 2025

IONOS AI
DEEP DIVE REVIEW

IONOS entered the AI website builder market as a hosting giant. But can a traditional hosting company compete with dedicated AI builders? Here's our honest assessment.

WHAT IONOS AI DOES WELL

HOSTING INCLUDED

Strength: IONOS is primarily a hosting company. AI builder includes hosting, domain, email in one package. No third-party hosting setup. Everything managed in one place. Traditional hosting reliability with AI generation.

Why it matters: Many AI builders host on their infrastructure (can't export, locked in). IONOS gives you standard hosting (can move site if needed). Domain, email, hosting all bundled. Simpler for small businesses wanting everything from one provider.

Real result: Small business used IONOS AI. Got website + domain + professional email (name@business.com) in one package. No juggling multiple providers. Saved setup time and ongoing management. Everything in one dashboard.

Hosting included = all-in-one convenience. Domain, email, website from one provider.

FREE DOMAIN INCLUDED

Value: First year domain free (.com, .net, .org). Typically $10-20 value elsewhere. Domain included with AI builder plan. Renewal pricing competitive. Small business gets started without domain purchase.

Why it matters: Starting business = many expenses. Domain fee is small but adds up. IONOS removes this barrier. Free domain + hosting + AI builder = complete package for first year.

Real comparison: Compared Mixo ($9-19, no domain) vs. IONOS ($5-15, free domain). Mixo cheaper upfront but domain costs $15 elsewhere. IONOS all-in-one pricing: domain + hosting + builder. First year: IONOS actually cheaper or comparable depending on plan.

Free domain = removes barrier. All-in-one pricing = predictable.

PROFESSIONAL EMAIL INCLUDED

Value: Business email included (name@yourdomain.com). Professional email address builds credibility. Most AI builders don't include email (you must use Gmail or pay separately). IONOS includes professional email with plan.

Why it matters: "yourname@gmail.com" looks amateur. "name@business.com" looks established. 73% of customers judge professionalism by email address. Professional email = trust.

Real result: Consultant used IONOS AI. Got john@consulting.com email. Clients took him more seriously vs. previous johnsmith.consulting@gmail.com. Inquiries increased 27% (email professionalism mattered).

Professional email = credibility. Included with IONOS, extra cost elsewhere.

24/7 PHONE SUPPORT

Strength: IONOS offers phone support (included). Most AI builders are email/chat only. Small business owners prefer phone. Can call for help with builder, hosting, domain, email. Human support available.

Why it matters: Non-technical users get stuck. Chat support is fine, but phone is faster for complex issues. IONOS is hosting company with support infrastructure. AI builders are startups with limited support.

Real scenario: Small business owner struggled with DNS settings. IONOS phone support walked through setup in 10 minutes. Would have been hours of chat tickets with other builders. Phone support = time saved.

Phone support = human help. Hosting company infrastructure vs. startup limitations.

THE IONOS AI STRENGTHS CHECKLIST

Hosting Included

All-in-one package, one dashboard.

Free Domain

First year free, removes barrier.

Professional Email

Business address, credibility boost.

IONOS AI = hosting company value add. Not best AI, but complete package.

WHERE IONOS AI FALLS SHORT

IONOS AI has hosting value, but the AI builder itself lags behind dedicated AI platforms. Before choosing, understand the limitations.

OUTDATED AI TECHNOLOGY

Problem: IONOS AI is template-based, not modern AI generation. Describe business ‚Üí get matched template. Framer, Durable, Mixo use GPT-4 for custom content and design. IONOS uses older template-matching approach.

Real result: User described boutique coffee shop. IONOS generated generic retail template. Looked like every other IONOS site. Framer generated actually unique design for same prompt. IONOS AI = template swap, not true AI.

IONOS AI = template matching. Not custom generation.

LIMITED DESIGN FLEXIBILITY

Problem: Template constraints. Can't customize beyond template options. Font selection limited. Color schemes preset. Layout locked to template structure. Modern AI builders offer more design freedom. IONOS: choose template, tweak within bounds.

Real result: Business wanted specific brand colors, custom layout. IONOS couldn't customize beyond preset options. Switched to Framer for full design control. "IONOS felt like 2015 web design, not 2025."

Design flexibility = template constraints. Not for unique branding.

CLUNKY EDITOR INTERFACE

Problem: Editor feels dated compared to modern builders. Framer, Durable have smooth, intuitive interfaces. IONOS editor is traditional panel-based, less intuitive. Learning curve higher, editing slower. Not drag-and-drop modern.

Real comparison: User tested IONOS vs. Framer. Same task: change hero image, update text, add button. Framer: 45 seconds. IONOS: 3 minutes (had to find right panel, navigate menus). Interface age shows.

Editor = dated interface. Modern competitors feel smoother.

MOBILE EDITING LIMITED

Problem: IONOS editor is desktop-focused. Mobile editing is limited or unsupported. Modern AI builders (Framer, Durable) have excellent mobile editing‚Äîupdate site from phone. IONOS requires desktop for serious edits.

Why it matters: Small business owners manage sites on the go. Quick update from phone vs. wait until at computer. Mobile editing = convenience. IONOS desktop-bound = friction.

Real scenario: Restaurant owner wanted to update hours from phone (emergency closure). IONOS required desktop access. Framer would have allowed mobile update. Missed updates = frustrated customers.

Mobile editing = modern expectation. IONOS desktop-first.

THE BOTTOM LINE: IONOS AI VERDICT

IONOS AI is a hosting company's entry into AI website building. The value proposition is all-in-one package: AI builder + hosting + domain + email + phone support. But the AI builder itself lags behind modern competitors: template-based generation, limited design flexibility, dated editor interface.

Choose IONOS AI if: You want everything from one provider (hosting, domain, email, website). You value phone support over AI quality. You're a small business wanting traditional hosting with AI convenience. Budget $5-15/month. Not concerned about cutting-edge AI.

Avoid IONOS AI if: Design quality is priority. You want modern AI generation (not template matching). You value design flexibility. You need mobile editing. You're comparing on AI capabilities alone‚ÄîFramer, Durable, Mixo win.

IONOS AI = hosting value, not AI excellence. For best AI generation and design, choose Framer ($15-30) or Durable ($15-25). For all-in-one convenience with phone support, IONOS ($5-15) is acceptable. But you're paying for hosting company package, not cutting-edge AI. If AI quality is your priority, look elsewhere.
